page.title: 11D.H.Lawrence Centenary.
page.content: The year 1985 marks the centenary of D.H.Lawrences' birth and many tourists are visiting Eastwood,the place of his birth.The Lawrence family has strong connections with Brinsley. The family moved to Brinsley about 1840,all six children of John and Louisa Lawrence being born in the village.The school in the village at this time was St.Johns',situated on Main Street in New Brinsley,close to the present site of St.Johns' Close. Arthur,the eldest son, worked at Brinsley Colliery until 1867 and after his marriage to Lydia in 1875 they lived in a small cottage near the railway crossing with his parents.The cottage is still occupied today.Their first child was born here though David Herbert was born in Eastwood.He was a frequent visitor to his relatives in Brinsley,especially his grandparents.
